alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gadsden and northeastern Liberty Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greensboro, or 8 miles southwest of Quincy, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quincy, Greensboro, Chattahoochee, Gretna, Lake Talquin, Littman, Juniper, Douglas City, Mount Pleasant, Hardin Heights, Rosedale, Santa Clara, Hardaway, Sycamore, Quincy Airport, Lowry, Wetumpka, Branchville, Sawdust and Roy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
